channel.title: Comments on: Debug Java From Lotus Notes Designer
channel.description: Don't document the program; program the document.

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: You can download Dmino designer from IBM website. Enable remote debugging through notes.ini file of your server and then you can debug it from eclipse too.
item.content:encoded: You can download Dmino designer from IBM website. Enable remote debugging through notes.ini file of your server and then you can debug it from eclipse too.

item.title: By: chewbee
item.dc:creator: chewbee
item.description:
Hello, this is great but I am missing few points here
I just have an Eclipse(Juno) and my lotus Notes client
How can I build and debug from Eclipse instead of from Lotus ? I do not know where to get "Domino Designer" and how to install it in Eclipse
Many thanks for any clues you can provide
item.content:encoded:
Hello, this is great but I am missing few points here

I just have an Eclipse(Juno) and my lotus Notes client

How can I build and debug from Eclipse instead of from Lotus ?
I do not know where to get “Domino Designer” and how to install it in Eclipse

Many thanks for any clues you can provide

item.title: By: Rohan Mahajan
item.dc:creator: Rohan Mahajan
item.description: Thanks & Well done Rashid! You are doing gr8 job for our Java code developers. Keep it up.
item.content:encoded: Thanks & Well done Rashid! You are doing gr8 job for our Java code developers. Keep it up.
